meanings.definition: To make unable or unfit; deprive of strength or ability
meanings.sent1: A broken leg disables him from running.
meanings.sent2: The virus disables the computer system.
meanings.sent3: His fear of heights disables him from climbing ladders.
meanings.sent4: Lack of sleep disables our concentration like a fog over a city.
meanings.sent5: The storm disables the power lines, plunging the town into darkness.

meanings.sent1: The injury disables her arm movement.
meanings.sent2: The illness disables his memory temporarily.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much sugar can disable your focus.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise disables her hearing for a while.
meanings.sent5: The stress disables his ability to think clearly.

meanings.definition: To render inoperative or incapable of use
meanings.sent1: A flat tire disables the car.
meanings.sent2: The software update disables certain features.
meanings.sent3: Spilling water on the phone can disable its functions.
meanings.sent4: A power outage disables the elevator temporarily.
meanings.sent5: The lock on the door disables entry without a key.
